full_time.text: Full-time employment means employment for an average of 38 ordinary hours per week.

references.text: Full-time employment means employment for an average of 38 ordinary hours per week.
A full-time employee is entitled to the terms and conditions of this award that apply to full-time employees.

part_time.text: Part-time employment means employment for fewer than 38 ordinary hours per week.

references.text: Part-time employment means employment for fewer than 38 ordinary hours per week.
A part-time employee is entitled to the same terms and conditions as a full-time employee on a pro-rata basis.

casual.text: Casual employment means employment where the employee has no firm advance commitment to continuing and indefinite work.

references.text: Casual employment means employment where the employee has no firm advance commitment to continuing and indefinite work.
A casual employee is entitled to a casual loading of 25% in addition to the minimum hourly rate.

civil_construction.text: Civil construction work means the construction, alteration, maintenance or repair of civil and/or mechanical engineering projects, structures or works.

references.text: Civil construction work means the construction, alteration, maintenance or repair of civil and/or mechanical engineering projects, structures or works.
Civil construction work includes but is not limited to: roads, highways, bridges, tunnels, dams, pipelines, railways, airports, harbours, wharves, and other civil engineering projects.

fabrication.text: Metal fabrication work means the fabrication, assembly, erection, installation, maintenance, repair or dismantling of metal structures.

references.text: Metal fabrication work means the fabrication, assembly, erection, installation, maintenance, repair or dismantling of metal structures.
Metal fabrication work includes but is not limited to: structural steel, plate work, pressure vessels, tanks, piping, and other metal products.

electrical.text: Electrical work means the installation, maintenance, repair or testing of electrical equipment or systems.

references.text: Electrical work means the installation, maintenance, repair or testing of electrical equipment or systems.
Electrical work includes but is not limited to: power systems, lighting, control systems, and electrical machinery.

mechanical.text: Mechanical work means the installation, maintenance, repair or testing of mechanical equipment or systems.

references.text: Mechanical work means the installation, maintenance, repair or testing of mechanical equipment or systems.
Mechanical work includes but is not limited to: HVAC systems, industrial machinery, pumps, and mechanical plant.

general.text: General building work means the construction, alteration, maintenance or repair of buildings and structures.

references.text: General building work means the construction, alteration, maintenance or repair of buildings and structures.
General building work includes but is not limited to: residential, commercial, and industrial buildings.
